channel.title: Pitkin County|Colorado|United States on Roadsign Pictures
channel.description: Recent content in Pitkin County|Colorado|United States on Roadsign Pictures

item.title: CO-82 East - Independence Pass
item.description: Independence Pass on CO-82 east. Independence Pass is 12,095 Feet and on the Continental Divide. Independence Pass is one of the highest mountain passes in Colorado on the state highway system. The only higher pass on the state highway system is US-34 in Rocky Mountain National Park. Independence Pass divides the Arkansas River watershed which flows into the Gulf of Mexico; and the Roaring Fork River which flows into the Colorado River and the Gulf of California.

item.title: CO-82 East - Aspen
item.description: CO-82 east (Original St.) at East Cooper Ave. in Aspen. Turn left on Cooper Ave. to continue east on CO-82 and for the Top of the Rockies Scenic Byway.

item.title: CO-82 East - Top of the Rockies Scenic Byway
item.description: Begin Top of the Rockies Scenic Byway on CO-82 East.

item.title: CO-82 East - Entering Aspen
item.description: Entering Aspen - Elevation 7908 Feet. Aspen is the county seat of Pitkin County.

item.title: CO-82 East - Snowmass Village Jct.
item.description: CO-82 east at Brush Creek Road south to Snowmass Village. Continue east on CO-82 for Aspen.

item.title: CO-82 East - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on CO-82 east. Distance to Snowmass Village Road and Aspen.

item.title: CO-82 East - Snowmass Creek Road Jct.
item.description: CO-82 east at Snowmass Creek Road. Continue east on CO-82 for Snowmass Village and Ski Areas.

item.title: CO-82 East - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on CO-82 east. Distance to Snowmass, and Snowmass Village Road.

item.title: CO-82 East - Pitkin County
item.description: Entering Pitkin County on CO-82 east.
